New Records: Wiese became just the fourth player in men's T20Is to bat and bowl in a Super Over
Key Match Events: Wiese started the Super Over by drilling a full delivery through the covers and then walloping the next ball for a six
Erasmus flick-swept the penultimate ball of the over through square leg to pick up another boundary
Wiese squeezed a yorker past short third to take Namibia to the highest score in a T20 World Cup Super Over
Wiese then gave away just two runs off his first two balls before getting Naseem Khushi to edge one onto the stumps
Oman managed just a single off the next ball as the total went beyond their reach and Wiese closed out the win
Post-Match Reflections: David Wiese expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their T20 World Cup 2024 campaign
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the third time a men's T20 World Cup game went to the Super Over and the first since 2012
Namibia's modest chase was built around Jan Frylinck to take the equation to 18 runs needed off the last three overs
Trumpelmann got Namibia off to the perfect start when he swung in a full delivery to trap Kashyap Prajapati lbw on the first ball
